answers.answer: Hello fishy,We're volunteers here with a lot of experience in Type 1 diabetes.  You'll likely get some info from others, too, so keep watching this site.
Search on the Internet under "inhaled insulin," and you will find plenty of information. These products have been under development for many years, and have only recently reached the market.

Sorry, I realize this may have been what you were referring to when you spoke of insulin inhalers, so you may be familiar with the literature already. It's just that I always hear it referred to as inhaled insulin.

question: OK,First post on forum. Diabetes for 7 years. Type 2 progressed to full insulin shortly. runs in the family.Went to a new doctor today and was getting examined and he told me a new treatment was out. He said about an inhaler. Well I know about insulin inhalers but didn't know if they were used much. So I asked them if this was what he was talking about and he said no. He said the medicine reacted with your pancreas.He said he would review the blood work with me and see him again in 3 months and he would prescibe the meds if everything was ok. He said 95% of his diabetes patients that use it had good results. Forgot to ask him name of medicine.So I have been doing some internet research and can only find insulin inhalers. Anybody know what med he is talking about?Thanks,
title: Inhaler?
